book.title: Tuesdays at Six
book.author: Eero Get Lost
book.subtitle: A Second-Chance Friends-to-Lovers Romance
book.description: Emma, a widowed engineer, returns to her late father's horse farm in northern England and reconnects with Luke, her first love and local farrier. Their structured friends-with-benefits arrangement on 'Tuesdays at six' evolves into genuine intimacy as they navigate grief, homecoming, and rekindled first love within a close-knit rural community. A high-heat, slow-burn reunion romance set against the backdrop of working farm life and emotional healing.

audienceMatch.title: Audience Match Analysis
audienceMatch.keyCharacteristics: High-heat, slow-burn second-chance romance with friends-to-lovers elements, set in rural England with explicit sexual content and emotional depth.

analysisOverview.title: Analysis Overview
analysisOverview.readership: Your book aligns strongly with readers in the 'High-Heat Contemporary Romance' segment. These readers seek emotionally resonant stories that combine explicit sexual content with genuine emotional connection and character development. They appreciate narratives that balance sexual tension with authentic relationship building, often featuring mature protagonists navigating complex life situations. Your manuscript scored 8.9/10 on engagement potential in this cluster, reflecting strong alignment with their tastes. Hallmarks of this segment include slow-burn pacing with high-heat content, second-chance romance themes, rural or small-town settings, and mature protagonists dealing with real-life challenges. Tuesdays at Six delivers all of these, from Emma's grief journey to the structured intimacy of the 'Tuesdays at six' arrangement. The explicit content is balanced with emotional depth, the rural setting provides atmospheric backdrop, and the friends-to-lovers dynamic adds layers of complexity. These qualities resonate particularly with contemporary romance enthusiasts who appreciate both emotional and sexual authenticity in their reading.
analysisOverview.classification: The classification of the book places it squarely within contemporary erotic romance, with an emphasis on second-chance love, friends-to-lovers dynamics, and rural English settings. Its structure draws on established romance conventions while bringing fresh perspectives to familiar scenarios through the structured intimacy of the 'Tuesdays at six' arrangement. The explicit sexual content is balanced with emotional authenticity, making it suitable for mature readers who appreciate both heat and heart in their romance reading.
analysisOverview.personas: The personas created within the report bring the audience to life, providing portraits of the book's most engaged readers. Sophie Turner, a marketing manager and divorced mother, represents the primary persona and stands as the most important figure for connecting with this audience segment. Her profile highlights motivations of emotional validation, resilience narratives, and authentic relationship development. The persona reflects the target reader's appreciation for stories that navigate grief, rekindle love, and balance independence with intimacy.
analysisOverview.marketingGuidance: The marketing guidance provides a detailed roadmap for reaching these readers effectively. It outlines practical strategies for digital campaigns, recommended targeting groups, creative hooks, and even sample copy and video scripts that can serve as the foundation for initial promotions. The report holder can use this information directly to begin their marketing efforts, tailoring campaigns around the story's strongest themes of second-chance love, emotional healing, and rural romance.

moodAndTone.subtitle: Emotional atmosphere and narrative style of your manuscript

moodTags.description: Deep emotional resonance with themes of grief, healing, and rekindled love that creates powerful reader connection.
Gradual escalation of emotional and physical intimacy that builds tension and anticipation throughout the narrative.
Explicit sexual content with clear consent and boundary negotiation, balanced with emotional authenticity.
Atmospheric setting of working farm life in northern England that provides rich backdrop for emotional story.
Explores themes of unfinished love, reconciliation, and the possibility of new beginnings after loss.
Evolution from structured friends-with-benefits arrangement to genuine emotional and physical intimacy.

personas.name: Sophie Turner
personas.coreNeeds: Emotional validation and narratives of resilience. Drawn to stories where characters navigate grief, rekindle love, and balance independence with intimacy.
personas.fears: Predictable romance plots, unrealistic relationships, lack of emotional depth
personas.values: Authenticity in character emotions, realistic depictions of relationships, strong sense of place, and high-heat intimacy balanced with slow-burn tension

uniquePositioning.title: Unique Positioning
uniquePositioning.description: Tuesdays at Six occupies a unique space as a high-heat contemporary romance that authentically portrays grief, healing, and the evolution of structured intimacy into genuine love. Unlike many romance novels that focus primarily on the romantic relationship, this story balances explicit sexual content with meaningful emotional development and realistic portrayals of life after loss. The rural English setting and farm life backdrop provide atmospheric richness while the 'Tuesdays at six' structure offers a fresh approach to friends-to-lovers dynamics.

marketPositioning.seasonalStrategy: Year-round appeal with potential for increased promotion during romance awareness periods and book club seasons

brandPositioning.coreMessage: A story about finding love again after loss, where structured intimacy evolves into genuine connection and second chances burn brighter than first loves.
keyDifferentiators: Authentic portrayal of grief and healing in romance

sampleCopy.title: Sample Copy
sampleCopy.backCoverBlurb: When Emma returns to her late father's horse farm in northern England, she never expected to reconnect with Luke, her first love and the local farrier. What begins as a structured friends-with-benefits arrangement on 'Tuesdays at six' evolves into something deeper as they navigate grief, homecoming, and the possibility of second chances. A high-heat, slow-burn romance that explores the healing power of love and the courage it takes to open your heart again.

socialMediaPosts.text: Looking for the perfect romance read? *Tuesdays at Six* combines emotional depth, high-heat intimacy, and second-chance love in a beautiful rural setting. Perfect for readers who love authentic relationships! #ContemporaryRomance #SecondChanceRomance #BookLovers

Romance readers, this one's for you! *Tuesdays at Six* celebrates the evolution of structured intimacy into genuine love, with mature characters and emotional authenticity. #HighHeatRomance #EmotionalRomance #BookTok

Escape to the English countryside with *Tuesdays at Six* - a story about grief, healing, and finding love again. Perfect for readers who appreciate rural settings and emotional depth. #RuralRomance #EmotionalHealing #ContemporaryFiction

videoCreativeScripts.script: Opening shot of a misty farm at dawn. Voice-over: 'Emma thought she'd left her first love behind. Until Tuesdays at six brought her home.' Cut to glimpses of Emma and Luke in the stable, charged glances, unresolved longing. On-screen text: 'Second chances. First loves. High-heat desire.'
videoCreativeScripts.soraPrompt: A cinematic trailer: rural English farm at dawn, a woman in her 30s arriving back, emotional tension between her and a rugged farrier, close-up glances, misty countryside, intimate yet restrained atmosphere.

videoCreativeScripts.script: Fast-paced montage: Emma laughing in a village pub, Luke working at the forge, a fleeting hand touch, the tension of a kiss not yet taken. Voice-over: 'Some loves never fade. Some fires never die.' End with book cover and text: 'Read Tuesdays at Six today.'
videoCreativeScripts.soraPrompt: Romantic montage in a small English village: cosy pub, horse forge sparks, slow-motion near-kiss, countryside warmth, intimate and emotional atmosphere with sensual undertones.
